paragraph: John, a successful businessman, inspired many with his vivid visions of a better society. He said that discipline and a courageous spirit were essential to achieving greatness. As he shared his plan, people began to think about their own potential. Motivated by his words, they decided to study hard and contribute to a brighter future.

sentences: After years of hard work and dedication, he finally achieved his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur.
The team's successful strategy led them to victory in the championship game.
Her speech inspired the audience to take action and make a difference.
The artist was inspired by the beauty of nature and incorporated it into his paintings.
I think it's going to rain today, so don't forget your umbrella.
If you think about it, the solution to the problem is quite simple.
He went to the store to buy some groceries.
He enjoys playing soccer on the weekends.
They made a plan to meet at the park after work.
The architect presented the plan for the new building.
She needs to study for her upcoming exam.
The scientist conducted a study on the effects of pollution.
The charity organization works to improve the lives of people in society.
The impact of technology on society has been significant in recent years.
Martial arts teaches discipline and self-control.
To achieve success, one must have the discipline to work hard and stay focused.

paragraph: Samantha enjoyed visiting various caf√©s around the world. In her private time, she liked to taste different kinds of lattes. Thanks to her passion, she usually knew the best places to find a great cup of coffee, because she had trained herself to recognize quality.

sentences: They held a private meeting to discuss the issue.
The celebrity tried to keep her personal life private.
He expressed his thanks to everyone who helped him.
She received a card filled with thanks from her students.

process.mistakeType: Placing stress on the wrong syllable
sentences: The process of making wine involves fermenting grapes.

I really enjoyed the movie last night.

He usually eats breakfast at 7 a.m.

paragraph: Robert, an excellent pilot, visited small islands where he would often develop friendships with the kind locals. He was a thin man who rarely ate rich foods, but he couldn't resist the occasional snack on a plane. One day, a colleague introduced him to the joys of homemade treats.

visited.pronunciationTip: You're pronouncing 'v' like 'w', which is wrong. To pronounce the 'v' sound clearly, try putting your upper teeth on your lower lip.
sentences: They visited their grandparents during the holidays.
She visited the museum to see the new exhibit.
The small kitten curled up in her lap.
He lives in a small apartment in the city.
She is a kind and caring person.
He offered a kind word of encouragement.
The company plans to develop a new product.
The photographer went to the darkroom to develop the film.

excellent.mistakeType: Placing stress on the wrong syllable
sentences: The chef prepared an excellent meal for the guests.
She received an excellent grade on her project.
The plane soared through the sky on a clear day.
She boarded the plane with excitement for her vacation.
He grabbed a snack from the kitchen before continuing his work.
She offered a snack to her friend during the movie.
He went to lunch with a colleague to discuss the project.
She asked her colleague for help with the presentation.

paragraph: Peter values the memories he has of the time he met the famous actress Sarah while walking in the park. He can recall every detail as they chatted in the fresh air. Peter continues to decorate his home with photos from that day which pays tribute to the precious thoughts it brings him.

sentences: They chatted over coffee at the local caf√©.
She chatted with her neighbor while walking their dogs.

value.pronunciationTip: You're pronouncing 'v' like 'w', which is wrong. To pronounce the 'v' sound clearly, try putting your upper teeth on your lower lip.
sentences: She appreciated the value of a good education.
The antique had great sentimental value to the family.

He decided to decorate his apartment with plants.

paragraph: During her free time, the president enjoyed a variety of activities, from skiing on thick snow to resting at home. She was never upset with her staff's choice of lighting in the living room. The tasteful atmosphere possesses a calming effect, allowing her to relax and recall fond memories under the glow of the lamps.

sentences: He checked the time on his watch before leaving.
She had a great time at the amusement park.
The store offered a variety of products to choose from.
She enjoyed the variety of activities available at the resort.
I can't recall the name of the book I read last week.

paragraph: Mary is an enthusiastic child who volunteers at the hospital on weekends instead of doing other things, like going to the mall with the other girls her age. She wasn't bored by the work. Instead, she enjoys wiping down the walls and rearranging the seats in the waiting area. It gives her a taste of accomplishment.

volunteer.pronunciationTip: You're pronouncing 'v' like 'w', which is wrong. To pronounce the 'v' sound clearly, try putting your upper teeth on your lower lip.
sentences: He decided to volunteer at the local animal shelter.

The walls of the room were painted a light blue.

paragraph: Jake was scared and upset and almost couldn't breathe while watching the TV broadcast on the virus. Then, he ate a piece of thick bread and pet his dog to calm his nerves. He is driven to protect his family well, even if that meant acting brave and being courageous. He knows that technology will help beat the virus someday.

sentences: The brave firefighter rescued the family from the burning building.
She was brave to stand up for her beliefs in front of the crowd.
The loud noise scared the cat.
He admitted he was scared before his first skydiving experience.
Modern technology has made our lives more convenient.
She is fascinated by the latest technology trends.
He bought a loaf of bread from the bakery.
She enjoys making homemade bread.
He is a driven individual, always striving for success.
Her driven attitude helped her achieve her goals.

The thick fog made it difficult to see the road.

paragraph: Sue failed her first experiment with cooking, so she tried again and fried some chicken for the meal. She was determined to feed the women and children. In her mind, practice makes perfect, so she got on her bike and bought more ingredients to test her best theories.

sentences: They shared a delicious meal at the restaurant.

paragraph: Lily dreamed of traveling and seeing beautiful places. She focused during lectures and got good grades in school to make that dream a reality. It was obvious she had great experience and methods for learning. Lily woke up each day with a smile, excited to climb the mountain of knowledge and see where it would take her.

paragraph: The young athlete liked to wear bright clothes that smelled sweet. She focused on taking deep breaths before each race. The straight track in front of her filled her with inspiration to run faster and become better, whether she won or lost the race. There was no defeat. This idea comforted her when she was resting by the seats.

sentences: She couldn't decide whether to wear the red dress or the blue one.
He wondered whether he should call or send an email.

comforted.mistakeType: Placing stress on the wrong syllable
sentences: She comforted her friend after the loss of his pet.

paragraph: Sarah admired and was impressed by the details of the ancient pottery in the museum. She was required to write some things about it for class, but despite her best efforts, she had doubts on where to begin. Meanwhile, the colorful patterns on the clay were breathtaking. Being surrounded by history gave her inspiration.
